### 18. Renewal of Your Policy
(Applicable to Annual Multi-Trip Policy Only)
This Policy will be automatically renewed by Us on the expiry date of the Period of Insurance shown in the Policy Schedule upon satisfaction of the following:
* a) Payment of the premium under General Condition 15;
* b) There is no prior written notice of cancellation given in accordance with General Condition 3 before the expiry date of the Period of Insurance shown in the Policy Schedule; and
* c) The Policy has not been otherwise terminated.

Before renewal of this Policy, You must notify Us of any Sickness, or physical impairment or infirmity of which You have become aware of during the preceding Period of Insurance.
questions: What are the conditions that must be met for the automatic renewal of an Annual Multi-Trip Policy, including premium payment, cancellation notices, and policy termination status?
How does the requirement to notify the insurer of any new sickness, physical impairment, or infirmity discovered during the preceding Period of Insurance affect the renewal process?
In what ways does General Condition 15 regarding premium payment interact with the automatic renewal clause for the Annual Multi-Trip Policy?
What is the impact of providing a prior written notice of cancellation under General Condition 3 on the automatic renewal of the policy?
How does the policy handle renewal if the policy has been otherwise terminated before the expiry date?
What documentation or notification must the insured provide concerning health changes before the policy renewal can be processed?
If an insured fails to notify the insurer of a newly discovered sickness or impairment before renewal, how might this affect the validity of the renewed policy?
Does the automatic renewal apply to all types of policies or is it restricted to Annual Multi-Trip Policies only, and what implications does this have for other policyholders?
How does the timing of the notification of sickness or impairment relate to the expiry date of the Period of Insurance for renewal purposes?
What are the consequences if the insured cancels the policy in writing before the expiry date regarding the renewal process?
How does the insurer verify that there has been no prior written notice of cancellation before renewing the policy automatically?
What happens if the premium payment under General Condition 15 is not made by the expiry date of the Period of Insurance in relation to automatic renewal?
Are there any exceptions or exclusions to the requirement to notify the insurer of sickness or impairment before renewal, and how do these affect the policy status?
How does the renewal clause interact with any general policy exclusions or conditions that might have caused the policy to be terminated before expiry?
What is the definition of 'otherwise terminated' in the context of the policy renewal, and how does it affect the automatic renewal process?
How does the policy ensure that the insured’s health status is accurately updated before renewal, and what are the implications for claims after renewal?
In the event of a dispute over whether a sickness or impairment was known before renewal, what evidence or documentation is required to resolve the issue?
How does the renewal process handle situations where the insured’s health condition has changed significantly but the premium has been paid and no cancellation notice given?
What is the role of the Policy Schedule in determining the expiry date and renewal eligibility for the Annual Multi-Trip Policy?
How do the renewal conditions balance the insurer’s risk management with the insured’s convenience in maintaining continuous coverage?
